description: Final digits of !n = Sum i!, i=0..n, (A003422) for very large n, read from right.
comments: Reversed digits of 10-adic sum of all factorials.More generally, the 10-adic sum: B(n) = Sum_{k>=0} k^n*k! is given by: B(n) = A014182(n)*B(0) + A014619(n) for n>=0, where B(0) is the 10-adic sum of factorials (this constant). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 12 2006
links: Index entries for sequences related to final digits of numbers
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{x, f=1}, While[Mod[f!, 10^(n+1)]>0, f += 1]; x = Sum[ Mod[k!, 10^(n+1)], {k, 0, f}]; Quotient[10*Mod[x, 10^(n+1)], 10^(n+1)]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Nov 18 2015, after _Paul D. Hanna_ *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
